synopsis: In episode #9, Vivek Menon joins hosts Devam and Ahir to discuss his journey as a filmmaker, the creative process behind his show 'New Normal,' and the importance of self-expression. The conversation highlights the challenges and joys of pursuing art while balancing personal and professional identities, making it an inspiring listen for anyone navigating their creative journey.
quotes: Your experience and your voice is the most unique thing you can write.
The best way of learning is by doing it and putting yourself out there.
If you can prove to people that what you're creating is good, they'll realize you're for real.
It's fine to be a filmmaker while also having a 'real job.'
You can't just call yourself a filmmaker; you have to own it.
Passion isn't something you have; it's something that develops through practice.
You will definitely learn something about yourself even if it's like, 'I definitely don't want to do this ever again.'
Don't be afraid to put your stuff out there.
If you spend so much time making something, you can't even watch it with people who are supporting you; that's ridiculous.
What if this is just a thing I don't achieve? That's something I struggle with.
